=== BugSquad Mentorship Program ===

=== How To Request a Mentor ===

'''NOTE''' this page is work-in-progress. Please bear with us while we iron out the programme details.

If you're new to the BugSquad and want to request a mentor you need to:

* Sign the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/conduct|Ubuntu Code of Conduct]]</nowiki>. ('''Requirement''')
* fill in, on your Launchpad entry, at least your IRC Id, your Wiki page URL, and your time zone
* Set up your Wiki entry, and include:
** A brief introduction about yourself;
** Provide an area of Interest (ie: Sound, Kernel, Desktop, Network, etc). If you do not know what is/will be your area of interest, just state that.
** Provide your Timezone.
** Time available to triage (estimate)
* As a recommendation you might want to read the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/HowToTriage|HowToTriage]]</nowiki>, your mentor will help you if you have any doubts regarding the processes there.
* finally, request membership on the <nowiki>[[ https:--edge.launchpad.net-~bugsquad-mentorship|bugsquad-mentorship ]]</nowiki> group on Launchpad

=== How To Become a Mentor ===

All members of the <nowiki>[[https://edge.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-bugcontrol|Ubuntu BugControl]]</nowiki> team can be mentors; they just need to know how the community operates and the resources more
than be knowledgeable in a subject. Their basic responsibilities are:

* Teach the basics regarding Bug Triage
** Review the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/HowToTriage|HowToTriage]]</nowiki> guide with the mentee in case there's any doubt of the process.
* Introduce the mentee to the general triage <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/HowToTriage/Charts|WorkFlow]]</nowiki> and life-cycle of a bug.
* Encourage the mentee to join the official channels of communication
** <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-bugsquad|BugSquad]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-quality|QA Mailing list]]</nowiki>
** IRC Channel: #ubuntu-bugs
* Introduce them to the related Ubuntu activities, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/|Ubuntu Bug Days]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/Meetings/|Ubuntu QA]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BugSquad/Meeting|BugSquad Meetings]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuOpenWeek|OpenWeek]]</nowiki>, etc.
* Encourage Package or Area of specialisation (ie: Server, Python, Kernel, Desktop, KDE, etc).
** See: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BugSquad/AdoptPackage
* encourage the "Adopt a Package" programme (to be beefed up).
* Encourage students to join the Bug Days and help to organize it at least once.
* Recommend them to help on <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing|ISO Testing.]]</nowiki>
* Send Monthly updates to the <nowiki>[[https://edge.launchpad.net/~bugsquad-mentorship|bugsquad-mentorship ]]</nowiki> list about their work with the student.

If you want to become one, please send an email to '''ubuntu-bugcontrol at lists.launchpad.net''' with the Subject: '''I Want to Become a Mentor - <<Your Name>>'''. And include:

* Area of specialisation (ie: Desktop, KDE, Python, Kernel, SRU, etc, and preferred #ubuntu-* channel.
* Launchpad ID.
* times generally available (please mark in UTC)

The Mentors receiving group will answer you shortly and will add you to the list of available mentors '''and''' to the <nowiki>[[ https:--edge.launchpad.net-~bugsquad-mentorship|bugsquad-mentorship ]]</nowiki> group on Launchpad
